meanings.definition: To surpass in striving or competing.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outstrive her classmates in every competition.
meanings.sent2: The athlete managed to outstrive his own record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outstrive each other in games to see who wins.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outstrive all obstacles in his path is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The young artist's passion to outstrive expectations shines through in her work.

meanings.definition: To outdo in effort or achievement.
meanings.sent1: They constantly outstrive themselves to improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outstrive their opponents and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to outstrive each other in their grades for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to outstrive all challenges led her to great success.
meanings.sent5: The company's goal is to outstrive their competitors and become the best in the industry.
